intro: Malouetiella mildbraedii, commonly known as the mildbraed's malouetia, is a small evergreen shrub native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
